clues.text: This movie jumped the gun a bit in 1996, actually opening on July 3rd
Giant creatures called kaiju rise from the title ocean & start a war on humanity in this 2013 film
The title of this 2013 Matt Damon film is a paradise for heroes in Greek mythology
This antagonist from a 1968 classic got its name from being a computer that's heuristic & algorithmic
1962's "La Jetee", about a man sent back in time to avert apocalypse, was remade as this numeric Bruce Willis film
A reclining Buddha, 49 feet high, can be found at the Wat Pho temple in this Thai capital city
In 1890 the population of this U.S. city bordering Mexico was 16,000; today it's 1.3 million
Don't be chicken!  Say this city became the capital of the Ukrainian Soviet socialist republic in 1934
This largest South African city is in a gold-rich area called the Rand
You'll be let down if you go to this South American capital for a mountain view, but there is the Palacio Salvo
A system for paying for a sofa in fixed amounts at specified intervals is this plan
I need to hear you say this is what the medical term "IV" is short for, stat!  Don't you die on me, clue!  Stay with me!
It described Adam Smith's hand (his literary one, not his literal one)
9-letter word meaning sterile or barren
"In wine there is truth"; in truth, this is how you say that phrase in Latin

This bean is the distinctive flavoring that makes a cream soda

A Detroit pharmacist created the Vernors brand of this soft drink in 1866

Al Gore Sr.

rounds.comments: (Alex: In this category, each response will be two words.)

clues.text:
Mick Jagger, &
what he becomes when he gives an autograph

A maiden of noble birth, perhaps "in distress" &
the flat, metal commemorative items you get if you rescue her

A 3-D piece of art, perhaps in marble, &
the cunning or shrewd word you are when you respond

A country or territory, &
to make sacred by applying oil

A choice, &
a magical elixir

rounds.category: THAT LITERARY TITLE GUY IS UP TO SOMETHING

clues.text: "He had had a nice, good, idle time all the while... and the fence had three coats of whitewash on it!"
This boy "wondered what picking the old gentleman's pocket in play, had to do with his chances of being a great man"

"Further and further back he cowered, as we, lifting our crucifixes, advanced"
"By conversing with the Houyhnhnms" this guy "fell to imitate their gait and gesture"

Poggio Bracciolini was renowned in this period of "rebirth" for finding lost manuscripts

In 1897 Ronald Ross found that the parasite causing malaria gets into the blood via this mosquito genus

This Black Eyed Pea dropped it low as Pedro in "Rio"

rounds.text: Leodegrance, king of Cameliard, gave the newlyweds a piece of furniture on the marriage of this daughter
